intro: Restio isomorphus, commonly known as the narrowleaf restio, is a perennial grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale yellow flowers. Restio isomorphus plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various small organisms.
